data.question: What is the space group of the crystals [Ln2Cu3(IDA)6]nH2O for all Ln elements mentioned?
data.answer: P3̅c1

data.question: Which Ln element's crystal has the largest volume of porous space at 273 K?
data.answer: La

data.question: How does the dielectric constant (ε) of the Sm crystal at 400 K compare to the maximum dielectric constant of bulk water?
data.answer: The dielectric constant of the Sm crystal at 400 K is 15 times larger than the maximum dielectric constant of bulk water.

data.question: What is the relationship between the Ln element's atomic number and the n-value in [Ln2Cu3(IDA)6]nH2O crystals?
data.answer: The n-value decreases with increasing atomic number of Ln.

data.question: What was the purpose of using Teflon-sealed cylindrical cells in the dielectric measurements?
data.answer: To prevent the escape of guest water molecules from the crystal above approximately 315 K.

data.question: What does the presence of broad dielectric peaks at approximately 170 K indicate about the water molecules in [Ln2Cu3(IDA)6]nH2O crystals?
data.answer: It indicates the freezing of the positional freedom of guest water molecules.

data.question: Considering the synthesis conditions, what is the common structural feature of [Ln2Cu3(IDA)6]nH2O crystals?
data.answer: All these crystals belong to the trigonal system with space group P3̅c1 and have channels along the c-axis where water molecules are accommodated.

data.question: How does the change in ε at high temperatures relate to the antiferroelectric behavior of [Ln2Cu3(IDA)6]nH2O crystals?
data.answer: The rapid increase in ε above room temperature is ascribed to approaching the antiferroelectric transition with increasing temperature.

data.question: Why were the atomic coordinates of the host lattice kept fixed during the MD simulations?
data.answer: To focus on the behavior of water molecules without altering the structure of the host lattice.

data.question: What does the negative dε/dT below 240 K suggest about the water molecules in the crystals?
data.answer: It suggests the existence of disordered water molecules besides the ordered water system.

data.question: How does the size of the porous space affect the dielectric behavior of [Ln2Cu3(IDA)6]nH2O crystals?
data.answer: Crystals with larger porous spaces than optimal allow the existence of disordered molecules, producing relatively large dielectric peaks at approximately 180 K.

data.question: What role does the temperature play in the mobility of water molecules within the channels of [Ln2Cu3(IDA)6]nH2O crystals according to MD simulations?
data.answer: At low temperatures, the positions of water molecules are well fixed, but with increasing temperature, the molecules tend to move, indicating temperature-dependent mobility.

data.question: Is the space group of [Ln2Cu3(IDA)6]nH2O crystals P3̅c1 for all Ln elements mentioned?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the n-value in [Ln2Cu3(IDA)6]nH2O crystals increase with the atomic number of Ln?
